news_header: A small plane missing in Alaska has been found, with three confirmed dead and seven more believed to be inside.
news_original_title: Missing Alaska plane found with three confirmed dead - US Coast Guard
news_text: The US Coast Guard has located the wreckage of a small plane that went missing in Alaska, confirming three fatalities. Seven additional bodies are believed to be inside the aircraft, which is currently inaccessible. The Cessna Caravan, operated by Bering Air, lost contact about 12 miles offshore. The wreckage was found 34 miles southeast of Nome. An investigation by the National Transportation Safety Board is underway. Difficult weather conditions have hampered search and rescue operations. Alaska's Governor and Senator have expressed their condolences.
